phrases: I have been studyin' real seriously...
You have got exams this year.
You need to sing a little louder.
That is what I am doing!
Nothing wrong with gettin' all threes.
Yer pa got all threes, too!
Yer already on the track to mediocrity!
Bein' mediocre just makes ya unique, right?
If ya do not need something, get out!
We do need you to do something.
Y'know, should not you reconsider this?
Are not no need for you to be cookin' for a stranger.
I am going to tell him, Cook your own food.
Do not you realize how doing things for Sensei gives your mother purpose?
With a son who can care for himself,
and a lethargic husband who just says s'good no matter what I feed him...
In a life with no challenges,
only Sensei's existence revives my heart as a mother, and as a woman...
It is been a week since I came to this island.
I still have not written anything I am satisfied with...
That was just spur of the moment.
I cannot call it my own style.
I came here to immerse myself in writing,
and to triumph over that geezer...
Why do you come here every day?
I have never seen someone in a stylish jinbei like that before.
Are not been to the base in a while.
Do not come in without permission!
What are you doing, barging in here?
Yer the one who barged in!
Do not tell me you pitched it!
The stuff that was in here when I moved in is all inside in that box.
These are important to us, y'know.
Look, this is not your base anymore.
We are not got no mind to leave here.
You know yer happy to be mixin' with young girls.
Do not say stuff that is easily misunderstood!
It was you, was not it?!
You taught this child all those indecent words!
That lady's the queen of Kabuki-cho!
Since it is nice out, I will go streetwalking!
You should be more careful from now on.
Tellin' us that will not do any good.
Ya just memorized stuff ya overheard us sayin', right?
Yep, no one taught me nothing.
Kids her age parrot phrases like a myna bird.
I am saying, the language you use is
Meanin' it is for an SM Club, right?
This is for a restaurant signboard!
Do not use my calligraphy tools without permission!
I can tell you are aimin' to write manga.
Do not talk about me wantin' to write manga!
Maybe it is actually easy to become a calligrapher!
Do not quite get why, though.
Yeah, I do not really get it, either.
There is a penmanship assignment in our summer homework.
Let us have Sensei look at it.
If I learn from Sensei, a big prize will not be just a dream.
So, please help us out, Sensei!
excite your mother as a woman...
I do not have time to play right now!
If I ignore them, they will leave eventually...
Do not come back today, any of you!
We are stuck dealin' with some guy too old to be this high-maintenance.
A calligrapher's got to be a real snobby jerk.
I hafta make it clear we cannot go on feedin' him.
What are you doing to Sensei?!
Do not look so great, though.
Still, why is he on the verge of death?
He is always like that this time of day.
He is been writin' stuff for a calligraphy contest.
I get like that before tests, too.
Well, between me and a guy with talent, I guess all-nighters do not mean the same.
It is when a guy can do anything with just a little effort,
when a guy like me cannot do nothing no matter how hard he tries.
Did you get all threes even though ya tried hard?
Hey, who would you hear that from?!
I feel like workin' hard, too!
Are not nobody who can beat me at that!
It is hidden in this room.
Just bargin' into a room is
I am pretty sure it is in that box.
says he still cannot write nothing good even after writin' all this.
Because Sensei are not got talent,
even after writin' lots, he thinks it is not enough.
I think Sensei's amazin', but I do not much understand talent.
I have studied this much already.
I am going with this style from now on.
So that is why I get all threes...
Naru, on second thought, Sensei really does have talent.
No, I do not actually get it.
Being able to work hard is the best talent of all.
Nobody can beat me at collectin' these.
If you try with all your might so nobody can beat you,
Oh, so you are the Village Chief's son.
Sorry to have you all do so much for me.
This is the last time we can bring you food.
Ma will not say it, but I think you have gotten to be a burden.
Besides, I plan to study seriously for my exams from now on.
I would like to try following your example, and make a proper effort.
I really like your mom's meat and potato stew, but I guess it cannot be helped.
Have you been listening to me?
I will bring you some homemade meat and potato stew for dinner.
No, that is not what I meant...
I would feel bad if that messy champon was your last meal from us.
I have to start cooking for myself tomorrow?
Sensei, you going to make rice or something?
I am admitting you for one night.
For goodness' sake, Sensei, why did not you say you were not feelin' well?
I kind of ended up with insomnia.
Yeah, I am hooked up to an IV, so I will be fine.
Does it hurt worse'n a shot?
We will fetch what you need for stayin' the night here.
If you need anything, feel free to call on Iku-chan.
This here nurse may be young, but she is a married woman.
Do not go puttin' hands on her.
Like I would want to do that.
Did you know shots hurt worse than IVs?
I guess I have been pretty tense.
I have to get back to writing soon.
And what are you still doing here?
Put down the toy car and listen!
We came to wish you well.
You girls came all this way to see me?
It is a school day, see.
Oh, so I am just a side trip.
That is still nice though, are not it?
Sensei, your IV's about to run out!
Will not it just refill itself once the bag runs out?
There are not no nasu here!
If you do not call Iku-neechan soon,
air will get into Sensei's arm and he will die!
The button's right by his pillow!
There was no need to panic.
The recent models will not let air get in.
I was already in bad shape.
Sensei, your temperature has gone up a little.
Shall I insert a suppository to lower it?
I refuse to engage in humiliation-play!
When that was done to me back in grade school,
I got so embarrassed that I threw up...
You do not need to confess your trauma to me.
We will keep him under observation for now.
Girls, do not go gettin' him overexcited.
What are you doing down here?
I will be sure to press it next time.
If anything happens to Sensei, I will press the nasu!
Look, the IV's all full now.
Nothing's going to happen for a while!
that there is a ghost in this hospital.
Truth is, I am scared, but...
I want to see it just once!
Her grampa totally made that up.
I am not listening to you guys.
I do not believe in ghosts.
What will you do if I hear you talking about scary stuff and cannot sleep tonight?
This hospital is old, so it is really scary!
I brought the stuff you asked for.
I have been waiting for those!
I am most relaxed when I am working!
Okay, time for us to be headin' home.
I am in the room next to yours.
Sounded mighty lively in there earlier.
Were not they all worried about you?
Those kids seemed mighty relieved when they heard you were safe.
Please get to feelin' better soon.
Please tell the Village Chief to bring me my writing tools!
Your fever has not gone down yet!
I have to write while the idea's still fresh!
I have to write it now!
His fever's gone up from excitement, so I will give him a suppository for sleepin'.
Your color does look a lot better.
It is thanks to the sposi-tree!
Be sure to take them as directed.
Why are you so far away?
Do not test my love for my husband!
Now to hurry back so I can write!
Oh, you are raring to go, eh?
The old man in the room next to mine really cheered me up yesterday.
Uh, where is the old man who was in this room?
You were the only patient here yesterday.
Most folks just go to the new facility.
Sensei, did ya see a ghost?
I brought meat and potato stew!
What did you do to your hands?!
What do I do with these blood-soaked onions you cut?
That is what the red stuff is!
Ma, I get the feeling I understand what you were talking about now.
We will continue to bring you food from now on.
